item.title: Jbutton
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:23, topic:308080”][quote author=Tenen link=topic=404164.msg2993216#msg2993216 date=1255399634]
Dear Adam,

The point of abraham’s flame was to inform you that simply giving somebody the code will not help. On the other hand, if you would have explained why the button needs to be added to a top-level container and given him a tutorial, then the OP would’ve increased in knowledge and, possibly, epeen. What you have just given him was fuckfood. Now, he knows to write that code, but what does it do? Explaining will help him see the bigger picture and comprehend problems on his own. Of course, we all want to seem cool so I don’t half blame you.

-Tenen
[/quote]Dear Tenen,

However, simply telling him to fuck-off accomplishes what? You notice that I was the only one willing to give him help; yet, you pick apart what I did. If you want to point out the wrong in others, you should start with the individuals that were unwilling to help.

-Adam[/quote]

I’m struggling to figure out if you are plain stupid or simply blind.

Read full topic

item.title: Jbutton
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Dear Adam,

The point of abraham’s flame was to inform you that simply giving somebody the code will not help. On the other hand, if you would have explained why the button needs to be added to a top-level container and given him a tutorial, then the OP would’ve increased in knowledge and, possibly, epeen. What you have just given him was fuckfood. Now, he knows to write that code, but what does it do? Explaining will help him see the bigger picture and comprehend problems on his own. Of course, we all want to seem cool so I don’t half blame you.

-Tenen

@OP:
Let’s say you have a plain piece of paper and a cardboard boat shape. You want the boat shape to be on the paper. Therefore, you must glue to boat shape onto the paper. Same thing goes for the JFrame and JButton. You have a JFrame (paper) and you want it to have a JButton (boat shape). You must attach the JButton to the JFrame with the add method:

frame.add(btn);

Furthermore, you can read a comprehensive and in-depth tutorial on your subject here: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/index.html

Read full topic

hey adam, you are cool for doing something most of the people in this thread were trying to avoid…spoonfeed

hey abraham, you are cool for depriving this community of general knowledge. Someone has to learn somewhere. As far as I’m concerned, I don’t give a shit what you think.

/cry
[/quote]hey adam you are even cooler for completely comprehending what most of the people were attempting to enforce in this thread. also, if anything, it is you who is depriving this community of general knowledge. we were trying to teach the kid to be independent instead of having him rely on a community for any small question he might have which could have been easily answered if he bothered to read a tutorial or at least search on google

good job on fucking up his chance to learn[/quote]
I wasn’t aware that a Computer Science major could deprive someone of a general knowledge question pertaining to java. And I’m pretty sure I have the mental capacity to comprehend what’s going on here; however, unlike you I’m not one of the assholes trolling around boasting about how much I know and how much I’m not going to share with other people.

item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:14, topic:308080”][quote author=Frell link=topic=404164.msg2992938#msg2992938 date=1255391452]
In all honesty its better than the shit they’ve been giving him.
[/quote]
It encourages laziness…so I guess it really depends on your point of view.[/quote]
I mean you could say something like

“frame is a component and so is JButton you must add the jbutton on to the frame ( hint: add(); ) ;)”

Help them understand it rather than throwing tutorials at them because as soon as you click that link you don’t know wtf you’re looking at or what to look for. Its not spoon feeding if you hold his hand and let him do some thinking. Eventually it will just click and he’ll understand how it all works. Until then don’t act like retards.

Im not really sticking up for him but in all honesty you ALL know people have asked worse questions than this. At least he knew to present code and his problem all he needed was a little help.

item.title: Jbutton
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

[code]import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;

public class Main {

public static void main(String[] args) {
    String text = "Enter what you want your JButton to say here.";
    JFrame frame = new JFrame("Nubsakes"); /*Create a frame with the title "Title" */

    JButton btn = new JButton(text);
    frame.add(btn);

    frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE); /*This is so the window closes when user clicks on the the X*/
    frame.setSize(700, 700); /*Create a frame of 700x700*/
    frame.setVisible(true); /*Set the frame visible*/
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
